thread.title: Frank Lampard retirement: Swansea tried to sign the Chelsea legend | Metro News
thread.title_full: Frank Lampard retirement: Swansea tried to sign the Chelsea legend | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Frank Lampard retirement: Swansea tried to sign the Chelsea legend | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Thursday 2 Feb 2017 6:44 pm Frank Lampard has ended his playing career (Getty) 
Swansea made a move to sign Frank Lampard prior to the Chelsea legend opting to retire, Paul Clement has said. 
The 38-year-old former England international today announced his decision to hang up his boots . In doing so he revealed that he had ‘received a number of exciting offers to continue playing at home and abroad’. It’s now been revealed one of those offers was from Swansea. 
‘We had a chat,’ said Swans manager Clement. ‘I think Frank appreciated that I called him because of our relationship. We had a conversation. 
‘It did not go very far, but it would have been nice. It would have been good. 
‘Frank’s ability as a player we all know about. But he’s also a good leader and character and a fantastic professional.’ FRANK LAMPARD: TROPHIES WON Premier League: 2005, 2006, 2010 
FA Cup: 2007, 2009, 2010, 2012 
League Cup: 2005, 2007
